Workjobs; activity-centered learning for early childhood education

These manipulative activities are designed to help children develop language and number skills as well as more general skills such as hand-eye coordination, observing, seeing relationships and making judgments. Workjobs in action: a glimpse 3. The development of language through workjobs 17. Perception 19 : Sequences 20. The rice game 22. Jars and lids 24. Corks 26. Button it up 28. The bolt board 30. The nail game 32. Hook board 34. The pegboards 36. Go-together bottles 38. The block patterns 40. Sock boxes 42. Keys and locks 44. The screw game 46. Matching 49 : The outline game 50. The little rugs 52. The part-whole game 54. The letter boxes 56. Labeling 58. Individual sentence charts 60. Spelling 62. The mailman 64. Classification 67 : The food game 68. Patterns 70. Animal habitat 72. Days of the week 74. The word board 76. Float and sink 78. Rough and smooth 80. The same-difference game 82. People pictures 84. The language boxes 86. Weight boxes 88. Sniffing bottles 90. Hard-soft 92. Work-play 94. The feely board 96. Large-small 98. Materials 100. Color sort 102. The button game 104. Classification 106. Sounds and letters 109 : Sound boxes 110. Alphabet train 112. Phonics boards 114 . Phonics arrow game 116. First-sound sorting boxes 118. Peek-a-boo word game 120. Supermarket 122. Animal cages 124. The development of mathematics through workjobs 127 : Sets 129 : Pincushions 130. The safety pin game 132. Easter baskets 134. Number lines 136. Number boards 138. Math recording name 140. "I counted" 142. Flannelboard groups 144. Number dots 146. Trees and apples 148. The number cans 150. Select-a-set 152. Cereal game 154. Hangers and clothes pins 156. The odd ball 158. Piggy banks 160. Cars and garages 162. Flowers and vases 164. The paper clip game 166. Number combination board 168. The nail board 170. Birthday cakes 172. Fences 174. Vitamins 176. Dangles 178. Number sequences 181 : The 1-10 train 182. Bracelets 184. Mach 1-10 186. Rings and fingers 188. Common objects 190. Combining and separating groups 193 : Ice cream cones 194. Airplanes and hangars 196. Hide 'n'go seek 198. Bead frames 200. Bead addition 202. Cars 204. Combination blocks 206. Snowmen 208. The beans 210. Relationships 213 : The cylinders 214. Syrup game 216. Measuring game 218. How tall are you? 220. Graphing game 222. The money game 224. The store 226. Time 228. Shapes 230. Cups and pitchers 232. Sharing 234. Estimating 236. Activity-centered learning: why and how 239 : How to begin 240. Preparation 241. Establishing procedures and routines 245. Record keeping 248. Using money in the Workjobs 252. Introducing a new workjob to the class 252.; "Workjobs" is a 255-page black and white illustrated resource guide designed to promote language and mathematics readiness through the manipulation of familiar objects and through a variety of multi-sensory experiences. The specified intstructional level includes preschool pupils. The book contains 101 activity-centerd learning projects, each which can be madeeasily and with inexpensive materials. Through working with the materials students are encouraged to draw generalizations.
255 p. illus. 28 cm.; Responsibility: [by] Mary Baratta-Lorton.
